entry.title: The Legislative Reform (Insolvency) (Miscellaneous Provisions) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order is made under section 1 of the Legislative and Regulatory Reform Act 2006 (c. 51) (the “2006 Act”). It amends the Insolvency Act 1986 (c.45) (the “1986 Act”).

entry.title: The Transfer of Tribunal Functions Order 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Transfer of Tribunal Functions Order 2009

entry.summary: This Order is made under the Tribunals, Courts and Enforcement Act 2007 (“the 2007 Act”). Part 1 of the 2007 Act creates a new two tier tribunal structure; the First-tier Tribunal and the Upper Tribunal are established under section 3 of the 2007 Act. Order making powers are provided under Part 1 of the 2007 Act to enable existing tribunals to be transferred into the new structure. This Order effects the transfer into the new structure of various tribunal functions.

entry.title: The Transfer of Functions of the Asylum and Immigration Tribunal Order 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Transfer of Functions of the Asylum and Immigration Tribunal Order 2009

entry.summary: This Order is made under the Tribunals, Courts and Enforcement Act 2007 (“the 2007 Act”). Part 1 of the 2007 Act creates a new two-tier tribunal structure; the First-tier Tribunal and the Upper Tribunal are established under section 3 of the 2007 Act. Order making powers are provided under Part 1 of the 2007 Act to enable the functions of existing tribunals to be transferred into the new structure. This Order transfers the functions of the Asylum and Immigration Tribunal to the First-tier Tribunal.

entry.title: The Employers’ Duties (Implementation) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision as to how sections 2 to 9 of the Pensions Act 2008 (‘the employers’ duties) apply to employers. Those duties include the duty on an employer (under section 3 of that Act) to make prescribed arrangements by which jobholders become active members of automatic enrolment pension schemes. These Regulations also set the transitional periods for money purchase and personal pension schemes (in regulation 5) and for defined benefits and hybrid schemes (in regulation 6).

entry.title: The Employers’ Duties (Registration and Compliance) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision as to the powers that enable the Pensions Regulator (“the Regulator”) to maximise compliance with the duties and safeguards contained in Chapter 1 of Part 1 and sections 50 and 54 of the Pensions Act 2008.

entry.title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Levy Ceiling – Earnings Percentage Increase) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order specifies that, for the purposes of section 178(3)(a) of the Pensions Act 2004 (c.35) (“the Act”), the earnings percentage for the period from 1st August 2008 to 31st July 2009 (“the review period”) is 0.9%.

entry.title: The Perpetuities and Accumulations Act 2009 (Commencement) Order 2010

ukm:Subject.Value: PERPETUITIES AND ACCUMULATIONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: PERPETUITIES AND ACCUMULATIONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order brings into force sections 1 to 21 of and the Schedule to the Perpetuities and Accumulations Act 2009 (c.18) on 6th April 2010. The rest of the Act, namely sections 22 to 24, came into force on Royal Assent.

entry.title: The National Employment Savings Trust Corporation Naming and Financial Year Order 2010
entry.summary: Section 75(1) of the Pensions Act 2008 provides that there is to be a body corporate, referred to in that Act as the trustee corporation. Section 75(2) provides that the name of that body corporate is to be determined by an order made by the Secretary of State. Article 2 determines that the name of the body corporate shall be the National Employment Savings Trust Corporation.

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions Credits for Parents and Carers) Regulations 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Social Security (Contributions Credits for Parents and Carers) Regulations 2009

entry.summary: Section 23A (contributions credits for relevant parents and carers) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 (c. 4) was inserted by section 3 of the Pensions Act 2007 (c. 22). It provides that a contributor to whom the section applies shall be credited with a Class 3 national insurance contribution for each week falling after 6th April 2010 in respect of which the contributor was a relevant carer.

entry.title: The National Employment Savings Trust (Consequential Provisions) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order disapplies certain provisions of pension trust legislation to a scheme established under section 67 of the Pensions Act 2008.

entry.title: The Overhead Lines (Exempt Installations) (Consequential Provisions) Order 2010
entry.summary: Under section 37 of the Electricity Act 1989, the Secretary of State’s consent is generally required before electric lines may be installed above ground. Under the Overhead Lines (Exemption) (England and Wales) Regulations 2009, certain minor works involving the installation of such lines are exempted from the requirement of consent under section 37.

entry.title: The National Lottery Act 2006 (Commencement No. 5) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 5 of the National Lottery Act 2006, which inserts into the National Lottery etc. Act 1993 (c. 39) a new Section 7A (Annual Fee), a provision for the charging of annual licence fees, and a provision for a licence to be revoked for failure to pay an annual fee.

entry.title: The Pensions Act 2008 (Commencement No. 5) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force sections 75 (in so far as not already in force) and 76 of, and Schedule 1 (in so far as not already in force) to, the Pensions Act 2008 (c.30) (“the Act”) on 5th July 2010. Those provisions establish the National Employment Savings Trust Corporation and make provision for its constitution and functions. This Order also brings into force section 99 of the Act which is an interpretation provision.

entry.title: The Public Interest Disclosure (Prescribed Persons) (Amendment) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order amends The Public Interest Disclosure (Prescribed Persons) Order 1999 (S.I. 1999/1549, the “1999 Order”) by amending the entry in the Schedule to the 1999 Order in relation to the Pensions Regulator.

entry.title: The Transfer Values (Disapplication) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations disapply Chapter IV of Part IV and Chapter II of Part IVA of the Pension Schemes Act 1993 (c.48) (“the transfer value provisions”) which entitle members of occupational or personal pension schemes to acquire a right to a cash equivalent of any benefits which have accrued to or in respect of them. Those chapters allow transfers out from pension funds.

entry.title: The Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Appeals) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations establish an appeals procedure in relation to the Community instruments listed in regulation 2. The fee for the appeal is £100.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Charges for Drugs and Appliances) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Health Service (Charges for Drugs and Appliances) (Scotland) Regulations 2008 (“theprincipal Regulations”) which provide for the making and recovery of charges for drugs, medicines and appliances supplied by chemists providing pharmaceutical services, doctors providing services under a general medical services contract or section17C arrangements, or by Health Boards to out‑patients.

entry.title: The Application of Pension Legislation to the National Employment Savings Trust Corporation Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations provide that legislation that applies in relation to a person as trustee of an occupational pension scheme applies in relation to the National Employment Savings Trust Corporation (“the corporation”), which has a function of acting as trustee of the National Employment Savings Trust pension scheme established under section 67 of the Pensions Act 2008 (c.30), with prescribed modifications.

entry.title: The Building (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Building Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000 (the principal Regulations). They do not apply to building work which has been completed, or for which plans or building notices have been deposited with a district council before the coming into operation of these Regulations.

entry.title: The Health and Social Care Act 2008 (Commencement No. 14) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order is the fourteenth commencement order made under the Health and Social Care Act 2008. It brings into force on 25th January 2010 provisions establishing, and making related provision with respect to, the Office of the Health Professions Adjudicator.
